item.title: About
item.description: I believe that the best way to truly learn a skill, a process or an idea is to build something that demonstrates it. My interest in computer engineering arises from my tendency to explore thought and learning: by combining computer hardware and software, an engineer can manufacture and program an intelligent machine that replicates part of their thinking. During the process of creating such a machine, one must break down the knowledge they want to replicate in its most fundamental parts and create an algorithm that demonstrates these parts.

item.title: Hello World!
item.description: I recently came across Hugo the other day while reading this article of my dear friends at deltahacker.gr. Thought it’d be a cool little project to make a personal website using Hugo in order to get to know the glory of static website generators and tick “Make a personal website” off my weekly checklist. It’s been a fun experience and a nice break from revising Linear Algebra.. Next task is to find out why the site’s favicon won’t appear on Chrome browsers and maybe brainstorm ways I can make use of this place.
